intro: Hieracium morulum, commonly known as the mouse ear hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and its leaves are hairy and heart-shaped. Hieracium morulum is part of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is also characterized by its distinctive, low-growing habit and is often found in meadows and open woodlands.
